radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple cystic foci, hypointense on T1-weighted images and hyperintense on T2-weighted images, in the neural foramina of the cervical, thoracic, lumbar, and sacral spine, typical of Tarlov cysts measuring up to 13 mm.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial MRI eight years earlier was reported as normal. Four months prior to the current evaluation, MRI revealed a lesion in the left T7–T8 neural foramen, causing mild expansion and remodeling, consistent with a perineurial cyst.

radiographic_examinations.findings: A perineurial cyst (10 mm by 8 mm) at the T7–T8 level on the left side that became filled with contrast material.

radiographic_examinations.date: One month after the CT Myelography
radiographic_examinations.findings: Bilateral T7–T8 neural foraminal cysts measuring up to 8 mm, with smaller foraminal lesions suspected at T10–T11, T11–T12, T12–L1, and low cervical levels.
